properties.address: 18-20 Cornard Road, Sudbury, UK
properties.description: A space for you to come in, stay warm and socialise, or if you prefer to simply take a seat, quietly read a book or newspaper and enjoy a warm drink and snack in a comfortable safe environment. Not only can we offer a warm and friendly welcome but if you would like to, the chance to learn a new skill, to try something different and the opportunity to gain recognised qualifications. Most of courses we provide are fully funded and can be offered to you for free.
properties.title: WARM SPACES - West Suffolk College Sudbury

properties.address: Stonehouse Road, Hadleigh, Ipswich, Suffolk IP7 5BH, UK
properties.description: A space for you to come in, stay warm, take a seat read a book or news paper and enjoy a warm drink in a comfortable and seated environment . *1-3pm weekends ONLY- an opportunity to socialise, take part in various activities (physical and/or social) in our warm community room and heat your meals from home! We can also offer you free access to showers and casual swimming sessions *excluding swim academy classes- take part in our weekend sessions to find out more.

properties.description: Sudbury Tourist & Heritage Centre welcomes anyone and everyone who needs a warm space (and a friendly face) to The Town Hall. Free services: Complimentary hot drinks available in the TIC. Free local history displays in our Heritage Centre & Museum. Charging points for your phones/laptops. Food and toiletries âDrop off and Pick upâ point at the TIC, everyone welcome to use this service. If you are in need of food or toiletries, please see Mel Mon â Weds and weâll be happy to put a bag together for you. Our staff love a chat (especially about all things Sudbury) so please pop in and stay as long as you like. We are fully accessible. We run Heritage Detective school holidays activities. Weâre dog friendly.

properties.description: From 11th November, Polstead Village Hall will provide a warm meeting place for anyone who would like to come along for coffee and light refreshments, to have a chat and meet old and new friends. Should anyone like to stay for lunch, soup and a roll will be available. The Rural Coffee Caravan will be visiting every 3rd Friday of the month and will have advice, information and support regarding the cost of living crisis.
